data.title: Coastal Carolina University Athletics
data.meta_description: Clayton Isbell (22) S  - Graduated with a bachelor's degree from Illinois State in the spring of 2022 ... Working towards a second bachelor's degree in communication
data.text:
2023 Football Roster

Choose a Player:

Coastal Football

22 Clayton Isbell

Class Super Senior

Position S

Height 6-2

Weight 220

Hometown St. Charles, Ill.

High School St. Charles East HS

Previous School Illinois State / Utah

Bio

Related

Stats

Biography

Graduated with a bachelor's degree from Illinois State in the spring of 2022 ... Working towards a second bachelor's degree in communication at Coastal Carolina.

Honors

2024 East-West Shrine Bowl 1000 Preseason List

2023 All-Sun Belt Third Team

2023 (Super Senior)

Was named to the 2024 East-West Shrine Bowl 1000 Preseason List

2023 All-Sun Belt Third Team selection

Played in 13 games on the season

Recorded 89 tackles, eight pass breakups, and three interceptions on the season

Tied single-game school record with three interceptions and added nine tackles in season opener against UCLA (Sept. 2 )

Season-high 13 tackles against Army (Nov. 18)

Tallied 11 tackles and season-high 2.5 tackles for loss against Texas State (Nov. 11)

Posted 10 tackles against James Madison (Nov. 25)

Notched five tackles and season-high three pass breakups against Georgia Southern (Sept. 30)

Finished with seven tackles and two pass breakups against Arkansas Sate (Oct. 21)

Prior to Coastal Carolina

2022 (Redshirt Senior) at Utah

Played in 14 games on the season, making one start versus Arizona (Nov. 5)

Recorded 16 tackles on the season, including 11 solo stops

Also had 0.5 tackles-for-loss and one quarterback hurry on the year

Had a season-high seven tackles and 0.5 tackles-for-loss in the home game versus Arizona

Tallied two tackles in four different games - at Arizona State (Sept. 24), at Washington State (Oct. 27), versus Stanford (Nov. 12), and at Colorado (Nov. 26)

Had one tackle on kickoff coverage in the regular-season win over No. 7 USC (Oct. 15)

2021 (Redshirt Junior) at Illinois State

Named a HERO Sports FCS Sophomore (COVID) All-American

Earned All-Missouri Valley Football Conference (MVFC) second-team honors

Started nine games at safety for the Redbirds

Ranked fourth on the team in tackles with 62 on the year

Was tied for the team lead with three interceptions

Was also credited with three pass breakups, 2.5 tackles-for-loss, and three quarterback hurries

Recorded seven or more tackles in five contests, with a season-best nine tackles against Missouri State (Oct. 2) and North Dakota State (Oct. 16)

Finished with eight tackles in the road game at North Dakota (Nov. 13)

Returned an interception 40 yards for a touchdown on top of seven tackles, 1.0 tackle-for-loss, and a quarterback hurry in the win over UNI (Nov. 6)

2020-21 (Redshirt Sophomore) at Illinois State

Redbirds played in an abbreviated spring season due to the COVID-19 pandemic

Started all four games at safety

Was tied for fourth on the team with 20 tackles, including 12 solo stops

Also recorded two pass breakups, forced a fumble, recovered a fumble, and had one quarterback hurry

Posted a season-high seven tackles and 2.0 tackles-for-loss at North Dakota State (March 13, 2021)

Also forced a fumble and recovered a fumble versus NDSU

Had five stops at home against Western Illinois (March 20, 2021)

Recorded four tackles and a pass breakup against South Dakota (Feb. 27, 2021)

Totaled four tackles and a quarterback hurry at UNI (March 6, 2021)

2019 (Redshirt Freshman) at Illinois State

Earned HERO Sports FCS Freshman All-America honorable mention honors

Was a Missouri Valley Football Conference All-Newcomer team selection

Played in all 15 games for the Redbirds, serving as the teamâ€™s primary nickelback

Finished the season with 23 total tackles, 2.0 sacks, 3.0 tackles-for-loss, and two interceptions

Also credited with a fumble recovery, pass breakup, and two quarterback hurries

Recorded a season-high nine tackles and a sack in a win over Northern Arizona (Sept. 21)

Tallied his first career interception and had two tackles in a win over Morehead State (Sept. 7)

Had a sack and three tackles in a victory at Southern Illinois (Oct. 12)

Was credited with 1.0 tackle-for-loss and a fumble recovery in a win over Indiana State (Oct. 26)

Picked off a second pass of the season in the second-round FCS playoff win at Central Arkansas (Dec. 7)

2018 (Freshman) at Illinois State

Redshirted

High School

Earned all-area and all-conference honors in both his junior and senior seasons at St. Charles East High School

Led his team to a conference championship in his junior season

Has two siblings
